required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Listeners will rate overall preference, listening effort, and artifact disturbance of recordings of talkers in a moving car processed using four different microphone processing strategies: an investigational adaptive directional microphone, two existing adaptive directional microphones and a fixed directional microphone. Participants will listen to the recordings streamed via commercially-available and individually-prescribed hearing aids, and conduct ratings onsite in the lab. The procedure will involve a training session and within-subject repeated measures. Stimuli will be randomized.

primary_outcome.description: The sound quality ratings will be conducted via a computer-based questionnaire that contains sound samples that participants listen to and rate. Sound quality rating scales are continuous and range from 0 (worst) to 100 (best) with 5 descriptors unique to the dimension at 5 intervals on the scale (10, 30, 50, 70, 90) Dimensions rated are: Speech clarity: Very unclear, Unclear, Slightly clear, Clear, Very clear Noise disturbance: Very annoying, Annoying, Slightly annoying, Audible but not annoying, Inaudible Artifact disturbance: Very annoying, Annoying, Slightly annoying, Audible but not annoying, Inaudible

arm_group.description: Receiver-in-canal hearing aid with an investigational adaptive directional microphone strategy.
Receiver-in-canal hearing aid with a comparator adaptive directional microphone strategy 1.
Receiver-in-canal hearing aid with a comparator adaptive directional microphone strategy 2.
Receiver-in-canal hearing aid with a comparator fixed directional microphone strategy.

intervention.description: A receiver-in-canal hearing aid developed by the Study Sponsor used with the investigational adaptive directional microphone strategy that is expected to improve sound quality of speech in a car.

A receiver-in-canal hearing aid developed by the Study Sponsor used with the comparator adaptive directional microphone strategy 1 that is used with the default settings as specified in the manufacturer's fitting software.

A receiver-in-canal hearing aid developed by the Study Sponsor used with the comparator adaptive directional microphone strategy 2 that is used with the default settings as specified in the manufacturer's fitting software.

A receiver-in-canal hearing aid developed by the Study Sponsor used with the comparator fixed directional microphone strategy that is used with the default settings as specified in the manufacturer's fitting software.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (18-99 years) with â‰¥3 months hearing aid experience
- binaural, symmetric, sensorineural N2 (mild) to N5 (severe) hearing loss
- fluent in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- children/teenagers
- normal hearing or hearing loss exceeding N5 (severe) by 10 dB
